channel.title: Toddcast, with Todd Lyons
channel.description: A podcast for, and about, public servants.
channel.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
channel.itunes:subtitle: A show for, and about, public servants
channel.itunes:summary: This podcast explores the human side of the Government of Canada. The public service is us... and we have stories, perspectives, hope, and good humour to share in abundance.
channel.media:description: A show for, and about, public servants.

item.title: Child of a Child
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: At the heart of every Toddcast episode is a personal conversation. Editing reduces it for length, accelerates the story for dramatic effect, and puts everything in the correct order when events are remembered out of sequence. Music and monologue turn it into something we recognize as a podcast. But what does a human story sound like, organic and unprocessed? In this unedited chat with Natasha Fraser, she remembers her life growing up as the child of a teenage mother.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this unedited chat with Natasha Fraser, she remembers her life growing up as the child of a teenage mother.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: At the heart of every Toddcast episode is a personal conversation. Editing reduces it for length, accelerates the story for dramatic effect, and puts everything in the correct order when events are remembered out of sequence. Music and monologue turn it into something we recognize as a podcast. But what does a human story sound like, organic and unprocessed? In this unedited chat with Natasha Fraser, she remembers her life growing up as the child of a teenage mother.

item.title: The Jagged Path
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: Mackenzie Kitchen shares a truth that we should all take to heart. There is no straight path to success.
item.itunes:subtitle: There is no straight path to success.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: Mackenzie Kitchen shares a truth that we should all take to heart. There is no straight path to success.

item.title: Listener Questions
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: On this, the 50th episode of Toddcast, Todd answers questions about himself, the podcast, and the podcasting medium.
item.itunes:subtitle: Todd answers questions about himself, the podcast, and the podcasting medium.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: On this, the 50th episode of Toddcast, Todd answers questions about himself, the podcast, and the podcasting medium.

item.title: Inaccessibility
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: Ten years into her public service career, now moving to Ottawa, Jen Ferris is ready to see whether her next ten years have more of the same difficulties in accommodation. The public service failed her in 2001. Would the next decade demonstrate the improvement she should reasonably expect?
item.itunes:subtitle: The public service failed her in 2001. Would the next decade demonstrate the improvement she should reasonably expect?
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: Ten years into her public service career, now moving to Ottawa, Jen Ferris is ready to see whether her next ten years have more of the same difficulties in accommodation. The public service failed her in 2001. Would the next decade demonstrate the improvement she should reasonably expect?

item.title: Born Blind
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: Abandoned on the street. Apprehended by police. Admitted to an orphanage. The story of Jen Ferris in her own words.
item.itunes:subtitle: Abandoned on the street. Apprehended by police. Admitted to an orphanage.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: Abandoned on the street. Apprehended by police. Admitted to an orphanage. The story of Jen Ferris in her own words.

item.title: Indigenous Reconciliation
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: Roles and approaches for Public Servants interested in making meaningful strides along the pathway towards Indigenous Reconciliation.
item.itunes:subtitle: Roles and approaches for Public Servants interested in making meaningful strides along the pathway towards Indigenous Reconciliation.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: Roles and approaches for Public Servants interested in making meaningful strides along the pathway towards Indigenous Reconciliation.

item.title: Transgender Too
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description: Last season we spoke with Kathryn Foss. She's a Major in the Canadian Armed Forces who has served for nearly 30 years and a transgender woman who was just beginning her journey into transition. On this episode, a conversation with someone well on her way to becoming the person she always felt she was inside.
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation with someone well on her way to becoming the person she always felt she was inside.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: Last season we spoke with Kathryn Foss. She's a Major in the Canadian Armed Forces who has served for nearly 30 years and a transgender woman who was just beginning her journey into transition. On this episode, a conversation with someone well on her way to becoming the person she always felt she was inside.

item.title: Men Behaving Badly
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)

Greg White and Pierre-Luc Poisson on male privilege, feminism, and masculinity.

item.title: Coming to Canada
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description:
We're a country of immigrants, but many of us don't give much thought to what that means. On this episode, a discussion with someone deeply aware of a life they escaped, and the gift they try to repay in their daily work.

Stream or download in MP3 format.


Also available on Google Play Music, Apple Podcasts (iTunes) and Stitcher. Or, subscribe with your favourite podcast app.

Transcript:
  • PDF
  • Plain Text
item.itunes:subtitle: We're a country of immigrants, but many of us don't give much thought to what that means. On this episode, a discussion with someone deeply aware of a life they escaped, and the gift they try to repay in their daily work.

item.title: Disability Management, with Elizabeth Ellis
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description:
On any given day, about 1 in 10 members of Canada’s workforce is absent due to illness or injury.

Part of this comes from our aging society, but all of us are susceptible when stress, anxiety, depression, and personal and family crises make it difficult to balance responsibilities of work and home life.

On this edition of Toddcast, a conversation with Elizabeth Ellis.

Stream or download in MP3 format.


Also available on Google Play Music, Apple Podcasts (iTunes) and Stitcher. Or, subscribe with your favourite podcast app.
item.itunes:subtitle: On any given day, about 1 in 10 members of Canada’s workforce is absent due to illness or injury. Part of this comes from our aging society, but all of us are susceptible when stress, anxiety, depression, and personal and family crises make it difficult.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: On any given day, about 1 in 10 members of Canada’s workforce is absent due to illness or injury. Part of this comes from our aging society, but all of us are susceptible when stress, anxiety, depression, and personal and family crises make it difficult to balance responsibilities of work and home life. On this edition of Toddcast, a conversation with Elizabeth Ellis.

item.title: Left Behind, with Nancy Kehoe
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description:
When the people closest to us decide that taking their life entails less pain than living it, we—and others—are left behind in that wake... left to ponder the question, "Why?"

Stream or download in MP3 format.


Also available on Google Play Music, Apple Podcasts (iTunes) and Stitcher. Or, subscribe with your favourite podcast app.
item.itunes:subtitle: When the people closest to us decide that taking their life entails less pain than living it, we—and others—are left behind in that wake... left to ponder the question, "Why?"

item.title: Meet Vicki Fleury
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description:
Vicki Fleury, on making the leap from student to employee, on her Young Professionals Network involvement, and in… her amazing socks. Yes, socks. Plus, we reach into the Toddcast mailbag and share some well-wishes received for this, our first anniversary.

If you're not a Gnorman fan, skip to the 5-minute mark.

Stream, or download in MP3 format.



Subscribe with your favourite podcast app or web/RSS aggregator.

Also available on Google Play Music, iTunes, and Stitcher.

item.title: Gender Violence and Workplace Discrimination
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description:
Yara El Helou, Sage Cram and a third guest address the topic of workplace bullying, harassment and violence, with statistics and personal accounts.

  • Yara El Helou's segment begins at the 5:30 mark.
  • Sage Cram's personal story begins at 20:55.
  • Third story (anonymous) begins at 27:40

item.title: Chillin' with Ilia
item.author: todd@toddlyons.ca (Todd Lyons)
item.description:
I've launched a new podcast for and about public servants. It will focus on the human side of the Government of Canada, sharing good news and personal stories: some humour, some tears.

Episode 1 is decidedly light and upbeat for the most part, but with a nod at the serious side you can expect in other episodes. Everything comes wrapped in music from Creative Commons, and there will be outtakes at the end for those strong enough to endure me reading the show credits.

A GCconnex group (only accessible within the GC network) has also been established for listeners who want to discuss any aspect of the show.

Join me for (what I hope is) an interesting ride. Stream it below, or download the MP3 file.



Subscribe via your favourite podcast app or RSS reader.

Also available on Google Play Music, iTunes, and Stitcher.
item.itunes:subtitle: I've launched a new podcast for and about public servants. It will focus on the human side of the Government of Canada, sharing good news and personal stories: some humour, some tears.
item.itunes:author: Todd Lyons
item.itunes:summary: I've launched a new podcast for and about public servants. It will focus on the human side of the Government of Canada, sharing good news and personal stories: some humour, some tears. Episode 1 is decidedly light and upbeat for the most part, but with a nod at the serious side you can expect in other episodes. Everything comes wrapped in music from Creative Commons, and there will be outtakes at the end for those strong enough to endure me reading the show credits. A GCconnex group (only accessible within the GC network) has also been established for listeners who want to discuss any aspect of the show. Join me for (what I hope is) an interesting ride.
